statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -10 \\ -9 \\ -3 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 0 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -1 \\ 5 \\ -1 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -10 \\ -9 \\ -3 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 0 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -1 \\ 5 \\ -1 \end{array}\right].
